noun.description: A name derived from the name of a father or ancestor, typically by the addition of a prefix or suffix, e.g., Johnson, O'Brien, Ivanovich.

adjective.description: Denoting or relating to a name derived from the name of a father or male ancestor.

origin: Early 17th century: via late Latin from Greek patrōnumikos, from patrōnumos, from patēr, patr- father + onuma name.
